questions.answer_description:
You are not charged for Azure Active Directory Groups. Therefore, deleting unused groups will not reduce your Azure costs.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/advisor/advisor-cost-recommendations#reduce-costs-by-deleting-or-reconfiguring-idle-virtual-network-gateways
questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
Your company has an Azure subscription that contains the following unused resources:
âœ‘ 20 user accounts in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD)
âœ‘ Five groups in Azure AD
âœ‘ 10 public IP addresses
âœ‘ 10 network interfaces
You need to reduce the Azure costs for the company.
Solution: You remove the unused groups.
Does this meet the goal?

discussion.content: The correct answer should be removing the 10 IP addresses

comments.content: wrong. the answer is B. Read the question carefully

discussion.content: Correct. Removal of unused groups will have no implications to the cost.

The first job in any Microsoft question is to properly interpreting the question as some are vague or even downright missleading.
This question is not asking for the correct answer- it is asking whether "removing unused groups" would reduce costs. The Answer to this is NO as removing groups does not reduce costs

Selected Answer: B
B is the answer.

comments.content:
Removing the unused groups in Azure AD will not significantly reduce the Azure costs for the company, as groups are a low-cost resource in Azure.

To reduce Azure costs, you should consider removing or deallocating other unused resources that are more costly, such as the 20 user accounts in Azure AD, the 10 public IP addresses, and the 10 network interfaces. Removing or deallocating these resources can help to reduce the Azure costs for the company.

discussion.content:
You need to read the question carefully. This user is using subscription plan, therefore, delete any group is no effect about the cost.
Correct Ans is remove public IP address
Since AD is tied to licences, both the idea of removing unused Groups and Account won't impact the cost, meaning the IP addresses still sounds the best option
Got this ? as a radio button instead of several questions on Jan 24, 2021
B is the right choice
To reduce costs, you should remove the 10 public IP addresses
Yes, it is correct

questions.answer_description:
Preview features are made available to you on the condition that you accept additional terms which supplement the regular Azure terms. The supplemental terms state:
PREVIEWS ARE PROVIDED "AS-IS," "WITH ALL FAULTS," AND "AS AVAILABLE," AND ARE EXCLUDED FROM THE SERVICE LEVEL AGREEMENTS AND
LIMITED WARRANTY.
Reference:
https://azure.microsoft.com/en-gb/support/legal/preview-supplemental-terms/

discussion.content: Thank you exam topics for deliberately confusing us with wrong answers.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Keyword ''Best practices" - Azure Advisor
No way! It can't be Azure monitor. The correct answer is Azure Advisor
D. Azure Advisor

Selected Answer: D
monitor doesn't gets you telemetry data and logs. Answer should be D - advisor
D is the way

Selected Answer: D
Azure Advisor provides recommendations to help align your company's cloud usage with industry standard best practices. Azure Advisor is a free Azure service that analyzes your resource usage and configurations, and provides personalized recommendations to help optimize your resources for high availability, security, performance, and cost.
Azure Advisor's recommendations are based on Microsoft's experience with running large-scale cloud services and industry best practices. The recommendations cover a wide range of topics, such as optimizing virtual machine configurations, improving network security, and reducing unnecessary costs.
By following Azure Advisor's recommendations, you can help ensure that your company's cloud usage aligns with industry standards and that your resources are optimized for performance, security, and cost-effectiveness. Additionally, Azure Advisor provides a dashboard that helps you track the progress of your recommendations and measure the impact of implementing the recommended changes.

Selected Answer: B
advisor
It cannot be Az Monitor. I agree with Az Advisor
Agree i think also Azure Advisor

Selected Answer: D
Azure Advisor offers actionable recommendations to help you optimize your Azure resources for reliability, security, operational excellence, performance, and cost. Do more with less. Reduce costs, increase efficiency, and accelerate growth with Azure.

D
Azure Advisor provides recommendations for best practices based on industry standards and your specific resource configuration. It analyzes your resource usage and configuration data and provides recommendations for improving the availability, security, performance, and cost-effectiveness of your Azure resources. 

So, You can use Azure Advisor to compare your resource usage and configuration to industry best practices and make informed decisions about how to optimize your resources.

Selected Answer: D
D is the answer.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/advisor/advisor-overview
Advisor is a personalized cloud consultant that helps you follow best practices to optimize your Azure deployments. It analyzes your resource configuration and usage telemetry and then recommends solutions that can help you improve the cost effectiveness, performance, Reliability (formerly called High availability), and security of your Azure resources.

comments.content:

What should you use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is the answer.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cloud-shell/overview
Azure Cloud Shell is an interactive, authenticated, browser-accessible shell for managing Azure resources. It provides the flexibility of choosing the shell experience that best suits the way you work, either Bash or PowerShell.

You can access Cloud Shell in three ways:
- Direct link: Open a browser to https://shell.azure.com.
- Azure portal: Select the Cloud Shell icon on the Azure portal
- Code samples: In Microsoft technical documentation and training resources, select the Try It button that appears with Azure CLI and Azure PowerShell code snippets

Selected Answer: A
Portal is only used when you want Azure Cloud shell.
